lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
* Encapsulates a task with a deadline.
* Similar to a task, a task with a deadline has a description,
* but also contains the deadline for the task.
* Constructor for creating a deadline task
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The deadline of the task.
* Returns string representation of Deadline task.
* Method override from toString() of parent class Task.
super.toString(), month, date, year, hour, minute);
* Marks task as done, and returns string representation of deadline task being marked done.
* Method override from markDone() of parent class Task.
* @return string representation of deadline task being marked done.
return String.format("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  [D][X] %s", this.description);
* Encapsulates a task that is an event.
* Similar to a task, an event has a description,
* but also contains the date/time for the event.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param at The date/time of the event.
* Returns event time of Event task.
* Returns string representation of Event task.
* Method override from toString() of parent class Task.
super.toString(), month, date, year, hour, minute);
* Marks task as done, and returns string representation of event task being marked done.
* Method override from markDone() of parent class Task.
* @return string representation of event task being marked done.
return String.format("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  [E][X] %s", this.description);
* This class handles the searching of tasks based on user's input.
* Checks if description of task contains input string.
* @param description The description of a task to be checked against.
* @return The boolean result of whether input matches a task description.
public boolean isMatch(String input, String description) {
* Returns a list of tasks with descriptions that matches the input string.
* @param input The input string to be checked for matches with.
* @param taskList The taskList to check against.
* @return The new taskList with the matched tasks.
public TaskList findMatch(TaskList taskList, String... input) {
// this way of searching ensures there is a match even if keyword matches the item only partially
* A task contains the description of itself,
* a boolean of whether task is completed,
* and also the logo tied to the task.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Constructor for a task with a specific logo.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param logo The logo for the task.
* Returns icon representation of status of task.
* If done, return "X", otherwise a blank space.
* Marks task as done, and returns string representation of task being marked done.
* The isDone field of task is changed to true.
* @return string representation of task being marked done.
return String.format("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  [X] %s", this.description);
* Logo is in a single alphabet form.
* @return string representation of logo of task.
* @return boolean representation of completion of task.
* The description is what user input at the start.
* @return string representation of description of task.
* String starts with a status icon followed by its description.
* Encapsulates a task that is a Todo.
* Similar to a task, a Todo has a description.
* @param description The description of the Todo.
* Returns string representation of a Todo task.
* Method override from toString() of parent class Task.
* Marks task as done, and returns string representation of Todo task being marked done.
* Method override from markDone() of parent class Task.
* @return string representation of Todo task being marked done.
return String.format("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  [T][X] %s", this.description);

* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.

* Encapsulates an exception meant for Duke.

* Overrides getMessage() of the Exception class,

* This class also contains methods that are

* and returns string representation of task being marked done.

* Encapsulates a storage to store the tasks of the user.
